job.description:
The Home team sits at the heart of the Spotify experience. Home is where hundreds of millions of listeners discover what to play next, re-engage with what they love, and build habits that keep them listening every day. Our mission is to deliver the most compelling, intuitive, and dynamic personalized Home experience in the world, across music, podcasts, audiobooks, and emerging formats.

Generative AI, large-scale recommender systems, and real-time personalization are fundamentally reshaping how Home is built and experienced. From generative candidate generation and ranking to adaptive layouts, page composition, and real-time personalization, Home is where Spotifyâ€™s most advanced ML capabilities meet direct user impact.

We are looking for a hands-on Senior Staff Machine Learning Engineer to provide technical leadership for machine learning systems powering Spotify Home. This is a highly impactful individual contributor role focused on shaping the ML strategy, architecture, and execution for Home, while working closely with product, design, data science, and engineering partners.

Join us and help define how Spotify feels the moment users open the app.

About Vercel: Vercel gives developers the tools and cloud infrastructure to build, scale, and secure a faster, more personalized web. As the team behind v0, Next.js, and AI SDK, Vercel helps customers like Ramp, Supreme, PayPal, and Under Armour build for the AI-native web. Our mission is to enable the world to ship the best products. That starts with creating a place where everyone can do their best work. Whether you're building on our platform, supporting our customers, or shaping our story: You can just ship things.About the role: We are looking for a Director of Trust & Safety Engineering to join our Security organization. You will lead a multidisciplinary group of software engineers and Trust & Safety professionals responsible for protecting Vercelâ€™s platform, developers, and end users. Your teams will design and scale systems that prevent abuse, detect fraud, and uphold platform integrity. This role combines deep engineering leadership with strategic oversight of safety and fraud programs, ensuring our platform remains secure, compliant, and trusted by developers worldwide. You will report to the CTO, Security. This role includes in-office anchor days on Monday, Tuesday, and Friday, from our San Francisco HQ. For location-specific details, please connect with our recruiting team. What you will do: Lead engineering teams that design, build, and operate systems to detect and prevent platform abuse, fraudulent usage, and malicious activity across the Vercel ecosystem. Develop and maintain detection pipelines that identify fraud and abuse, including AI-generated activity such as synthetic accounts, automated misuse, and malicious or spam content deployed via AI tools. Build systems that protect against billing and credit abuse, compromised accounts, and resource exploitation within Vercelâ€™s platform and infrastructure. Partner with Product, Security, Legal, Finance and Infrastructure teams to embed Trust & Safety program and fraud prevention capabilities directly into developer workflows and core platform architecture. Create automated enforcement and remediation workflows that act on suspicious or confirmed fraudulent or abusive behavior in real time, maintaining a strong balance between platform protection and developer experience. Drive the architecture and data strategy for trust signals, anomaly detection, and AI-driven abuse scoring systems. Collaborate with Legal, Support, and Policy teams to ensure compliance with global regulations while maintaining transparency and fairness in enforcement actions. Oversee the Trust & Safety operations team responsible for policy enforcement, incident response, and user protection. Mentor and grow engineers and Trust & Safety specialists, fostering a culture of technical excellence, transparency, and accountability. About you: 10+ years of experience in software engineering with a focus on security or trust & safety. 5+ years leading large, multi-disciplinary technical teams. Proven success building and scaling engineering organizations that deliver safety, security, or fraud prevention systems at global scale. Strong technical expertise in backend systems, distributed infrastructure, or data engineering, ideally within developer or platform ecosystems. Deep understanding of platform abuse, AI-generated fraud, automation-based misuse, and emerging risks in large-scale developer platforms. Experience designing or overseeing real-time detection and enforcement systems that use data analytics, automation, or machine learning. Skilled in building alignment between engineering, product, and policy stakeholders to operationalize Trust & Safety initiatives. Demonstrated ability to hire, mentor, and grow high-performing engineering and Trust & Safety teams. Strong judgment balancing innovation, platform reliability, and user safety in a fast-moving environment. Bonus if you: Have built or led combined Engineering and Trust & Safety organizations in developer, SaaS, or infrastructure environments. Have experience using automation, analytics, or ML to detect and prevent AI-generated or coordinated abuse. Benefits: Competitive compensation package, including equity. Inclusive Healthcare Package. Learn and Grow - we provide mentorship and send you to events that help you build your network and skills. Flexible Time Off. We will provide you the gear you need to do your role, and a WFH budget for you to outfit your space as needed. The San Francisco, CA base pay range for this role is $200,000.00 - $300,000.00. Actual salary will be based on job-related skills, experience, and location. Compensation outside of San Francisco may be adjusted based on employee location. The total compensation package may include benefits, equity-based compensation, and eligibility for a company bonus or variable pay program depending on the role. Your recruiter can share more details during the hiring process. Vercel is committed to fostering and empowering an inclusive community within our organization. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Vercel encourages everyone to apply for our available positions, even if they don't necessarily check every box on the job description.

job.job_description: About Us Temporal is an open source programming model that can simplify code, make applications more reliable, and help developers focus on the important things like delivering features faster. We are on a mission to be the reliable foundation of every developerâ€™s toolbox, and are building the team that will make that happen. Our values guide us â€”they are present in how we show up, make decisions, and work together to make an impact. Weâ€™re curious, driven, collaborative, genuine and humble. Temporal is growing and we are looking for those who share our values, challenge 'standard' thinking, and want to influence our future. If you have a passion for improving the developer experience, building world-class open-source software and communities, and want to be a part of our amazing team, we'd love to hear from you! Summary We're looking for a Software Engineer to join our high-impact team focused on product scalability, customer experience, and revenue growth. Our team manages essential services including customer onboarding and off-boarding, billing and metering, cloud marketplace integrations, and **Cloud Nexus.** Cloud Nexus is a foundational platform that connects Temporal Applications through a scalable, self-service ecosystem with a unified API abstraction layer. In this role, you'll work on systems that directly impact Temporal's revenue and customer journey. You'll collaborate with engineers, product managers, finance, revenue operations, support, and sales teams to create seamless customer flows and build reliable, scalable metering and billing infrastructure. If you're passionate about owning business-critical systems and working with diverse technologies in a supportive environment, we'd love to meet you. What You'll Do Build and Maintain Critical Systems: Design, build, and maintain mission-critical systems that power Temporal's customer acquisition funnel and revenue operations infrastructure. Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with Finance, RevOps, and Sales teams to understand core business requirements and transform them into scalable, effective engineering solutions. Contribute to Cloud Nexus: Design, develop and scale a key primitive which enables multi-cloud connectivity between Temporal Applications across teams, domains and regions. Ensure Data Integrity and Reliability: Develop, test, and maintain code for distributed data systems. Your work will safeguard the critical metering pipeline that drives almost all of Temporal's revenue. Grow With Mentorship: Receive guidance from experienced engineers while building expertise in Go, Kubernetes, Temporal, and cloud-native technologies like Kinesis, Redshift, Stripe, and more. Drive Improvements in Developer and Customer Experience: Identify opportunities to streamline customer experiences through automation, better tooling, and strategic system enhancements. Technology Stack Primary Language: Go Data Storage: PostgreSQL, Redshift, S3, Google Cloud Storage, Blob Storage Data Processing: Kinesis, Firehose Infrastructure: Kubernetes Third-Party Services: Zapier, Stripe, Segment, Pylon, Metronome Core Framework: Temporal (of course ðŸ˜‰) This role is ideal for early-career engineers who are curious, collaborative, and excited about building infrastructure for a hyper-growth company. What You'll Bring Hands-on experience developing software systems or services through coursework, internships, personal projects, or early professional roles, preferably in cloud environments. Familiarity with at least one programming language such as Go, Java/Scala, Python, or similar. Passion for building scalable, distributed systems and eagerness to deepen your knowledge in this area. Understanding of (or interest in) concurrency programming and how systems operate at scale. Interest in databases and storage technologies like Postgres, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, or similar systems. A breadth-focused mindsetâ€”able to integrate various systems to create robust, seamless experiences. Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a collaborative mindset for working in small, supportive teams. Enthusiasm for learning in a DevOps environment, including deploying and maintaining systems in production. What You Can Expect Fast-growing company with significant momentum Collaborative engineering culture focused on excellence Exceptional technical colleagues who inspire growth Streamlined processes without unnecessary bureaucracy Strong emphasis on delivering impactful results Action-oriented approach balanced with system reliability Commitment to incremental improvements and rapid iteration Compensation The estimated pay range for this role is $125,000 - $155,000 This role is eligible to participate in Temporal's equity plan Compensation ranges reflect salary and commission compensation (when applicable) across several geographic markets. Employment offers carefully consider multiple factors, including prior experience, knowledge, expertise, skillset, market location, and job level assessed during the interview process. Employee benefits and perks below are for full-time employees, part-time or temporary positions are excluded. U.S. Benefits Unlimited PTO, 12 Holidays + 2 Floating Holidays 100% Premiums Coverage for Medical, Dental, and Vision AD&D, LT & ST Disability, and Life Insurance (Standard & Supplemental Available) Empower 401K Plan Additional Perks for Learning & Development, Lifestyle Spending, In-Home Office Setup, Professional Memberships, WFH Meals, Internet Stipend and more! International Benefits Paid Time Off (PTO) and Benefits outside the United States vary by country, and are issued in partnership with Remote.com. Additionally, Temporal offers perks to all international employees for learning & career development, a lifestyle spending account, in-home office setup (in addition to company-issued hardware), professional memberships, work-from-home meals, and access to the Calm app for mental wellness. Travel Temporal is a globally distributed, collaborative team that values opportunities for in-person connection. Occasional travel may be required for company events, team offsites, and other meaningful moments that bring us together. Additional Perks $3,600 / Year Work from Home Meals $1,800 / Year Professional Enrichment (Career Development & Professional Memberships) $1,200 / Year Lifestyle Spending Account $1,000 / Year In-Home Office Setup (In addition to Temporal issued equipment - laptop, monitor, keyboard, mouse, trackpad, and extension power cable at no cost to you) $74 / Month Reimbursement for Internet Calm App Subscription for Mental Health & Wellness Temporal Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Temporal Technologies does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. job.job_description: The Aerospace Corporation is the trusted partner to the nationâ€™s space programs, solving the hardest problems and providing unmatched technical expertise. As the operator of a federally funded research and development center (FFRDC), we are broadly engaged across all aspects of spaceâ€” delivering innovative solutions that span satellite, launch, ground, and cyber systems for defense, civil and commercial customers. When you join our team, youâ€™ll be part of a special collection of problem solvers, thought leaders, and innovators. Join us and take your place in space.Physical Sciences Laboratories (PSL) supports the effective and timely development and operation of national security systems through scientific research and the application of advanced technologies. PSL has more than 150 specialized laboratories used to test, analyze, and troubleshoot virtually every aspect of rocket and satellite system design, development, construction, deployment, and operation. The expertise of the laboratoriesâ€™ technical staff allows PSL to stay abreast of new technological developments and program support issues associated with rapidly evolving space systems.Â The Materials Science Department (MSD) in the Space Materials Laboratory conducts anomaly resolution, advanced characterization, and applied research in materials chemistry, polymers, and composites. MSD is seeking a motivated early-career research associate with a strong foundation in chemistry, polymer characterization, and thermal analysis. This position is ideal for candidates who are eager to apply their training in a hands-on laboratory setting.Highlights of our lab's capabilities can be seen here: Virtual TourÂ Â The selected candidate will be required to work full-time, on-site at our facility in El Segundo, CA.What Youâ€™ll Be Doing Work in Polymers/Composites section of the Materials Science DepartmentThermal Analysis:Â Operate instruments such as DSC (Differential Scanning Calorimetry), TGA (Thermogravimetric Analysis), and DMA (Dynamic Mechanical Analysis) to evaluate polymer transitions, thermal stability, and mechanical response.Metallographic Sample Preparation: Mount and polish samples for cross-sectional materials investigationsData Collection & Reporting:Â Record test parameters, compile raw data, and prepare preliminary data plots and tables for staff scientists.   • Learn and apply proven best practices in designing, building, and supporting software

Qualifications

This role is critical for establishing scalable, efficient, and compliant tax operations across our growing landscape.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in one of our Brex offices â€” San Francisco, New York, or Salt Lake City.&amp;nbsp;We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Lead all aspects of tax at Brex, including planning, strategy, financial reporting, and compliance&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Manage the oversight of and partnership with external tax advisors as they provide coverage for our local and international operations&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Collaborate with Finance, People, Sales, Engineering, and other functions as needed&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Partner with Payroll and Equity functions in resolving employee-related tax issues&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Prepare journal entries and perform reconciliations over tax-related accounts&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ensure all tax liabilities and obligations are met in a timely manner&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ad-hoc projects, such as tax credits and incentive planning, as necessary&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;10+ years of public accounting or private industry experience covering domestic and international operations&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to both manage a team and operate as an individual contributor to fulfill responsibilities&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Talented and highly motivated with a self-starter mentality&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong interpersonal skills and ability to manage deadlines effectively&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent analytical, problem-solving solving and decision-making skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Credit card, payment processing, financial services and SaaS industry experience&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge and experience using NetSuite, Donnelly, Coupa, Looker and/or other data visualization software&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $235,040 - $279,110.&amp;nbsp; However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors including the candidateâ€™s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. We're the Music Mission Design team, a multidisciplinary group building the experiences that help artists and their teams grow, connect with fans, and shape culture. From rich data insights to messaging tools and release workflows, we design Spotify for Artists, our platform used by artists worldwide to manage their careers and tell their stories.

This role sits at the intersection of language, systems, and creativity. You'll help define how artists understand what's working, plan what's next, and engage their audience, all through clear, impactful content design. If you're excited about designing with language, collaborating across disciplines, and supporting a global community of creators, you'll find space here to grow and lead.

We're looking for a Content Designer to join the Music Mission. You'll focus on shaping clear, helpful, and impactful user experiences across Spotify for Artists, with an emphasis on analytics, release tools, video management, messaging, and prompt-based features.

This is a mid-level role for someone who's confident writing for product flows and systems, energized by complexity, and passionate about helping users take action with clarity and confidence.

You'll help define how artists understand what's working, plan what's next, and engage their audience, all through clear, impactful content design. If you're excited about designing with language, collaborating across disciplines, and supporting a global community of creators, you'll find space here to grow and lead.

We're looking for a Content Designer to join the Music Mission. You'll focus on shaping clear, helpful, and impactful user experiences across Spotify for Artists, with an emphasis on analytics, release tools, video management, messaging, and prompt-based features.

This is a mid-level role for someone who's confident writing for product flows and systems, energized by complexity, and passionate about helping users take action with clarity and confidence.
